text: Matthew "Matt" Anoaʻi (April 7, 1970 – April 17, 2017) was a Samoan-American professional wrestler. He was best known for his time on the independent circuit under many ring names, and his time in World Wrestling Entertainment (WWE), where he competed as Rosey. He was the real-life brother of former WWE Champion, Roman Reigns. Anoaʻi died on April 17, 2017 of congestive heart failure at a hospital in Pensacola, Florida at the age of 47 years old. ==References== Category:1970 births Category:2017 deaths Category:Deaths from congestive heart failure Category:Former WWE wrestlers Category:Oceanic entertainers Category:American Samoan professional wrestlers
title: Rosey (wrestler)
